ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I really enjoyed developing my own research.It was definitely more challenging than I anticipated.

The course was a good introduction to the challenges and tools of qualitative methodology. The field project was helpful in applying what we learned and the class was useful in discussing what we were going through on the field.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The instructor was very candid and open, but there was little actual instruction in the course. Especially since we were designing research based on the course and will continue to design research, it would be helpful to have more concrete guidelines and more feedback.

Strengths: Interesting set up and project-oriented course Weaknesses: Reading full books was not as helpful as having read fewer chapters of the book more closely. Full book (or more) assignments per week along with fieldwork led to a relatively cursory reading of the books on my part.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes, it is very helpful for students who want to conduct qualitative research

I think this class will likely improve over time. The reading was really good and the class discussions were interesting, but the takeaways from the class overall could have been stronger. I still don't feel prepared to conduct a full scale research project with qualitative methods, but I do feel like I have a better position to start.
Definitely - important learning for future qualitative work.
